preferences.value: prefers working late into the night and is most productive after midnight

evidence.quote: Not really. And honestly, I usually work late into the night anyway. I'm most productive after midnight - always have been.

preferences.value: prefers running; mood drops when skipping running

evidence.quote: Exercise, definitely. Like, I've noticed my mood just drops when I skip running for a few days. It's pretty obvious.

preferences.value: prefers lo‑fi or instrumental tracks while working and dislikes lyrics during coding

evidence.quote: Music helps too. I mostly listen to lo‑fi or instrumental tracks while working. Can't deal with lyrics when I'm coding.

preferences.value: doesn't like overly cheerful advice when stressed

evidence.quote: I really don't like overly cheerful advice when I'm stressed. It just feels... fake? Like toxic positivity.

preferences.value: wants someone to listen instead of immediately trying to fix things

evidence.quote: Sometimes I just want someone to listen instead of immediately trying to fix things.

preferences.value: prefers calm conversations with few questions at once

evidence.quote: I prefer conversations like this. Calm, not too many questions at once.

preferences.value: wants steady presence, not life coach or therapist trying to optimize

evidence.quote: I think I want this to feel like a steady presence, not like... a life coach or therapist trying to optimize me

preferences.value: prefers to open up slowly rather than dumping everything at once

evidence.quote: I also usually open up slowly rather than dumping everything all at once. It's just how I am.

preferences.value: considering switching to a less intense team in a few months

evidence.quote: I'm actually considering switching to a less intense team in a few months.

emotional_patterns.value: sleep disruption leads to next-day anxiety

evidence.quote: I get a lot done, but then my sleep gets totally messed up and I feel anxious the next day. It's like a cycle.

emotional_patterns.value: skipping running leads to a drop in mood

evidence.quote: Exercise, definitely. Like, I've noticed my mood just drops when I skip running for a few days. It's pretty obvious.

emotional_patterns.value: feels better on weekends, especially Sunday mornings

evidence.quote: On weekends I usually feel better though, especially Sunday mornings. It's weird but consistent.
I'm a software engineer and the deadlines just keep stacking up.
I live alone, so I think work stress tends to echo more
